attributes.action: Scrap the imposition of £15 surcharges on fines for motoring and other unrelated offences to fund spending on  victims of domestic violence.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: What on earth has eg speeding got to do with domestic violence ? Using tax revenues to address domestic violence issues is perfectly valid. Raising tax under the false banner of fine surcharges is not. Nor is the deliberate homing in on soft targets, like "criminal" drivers, to raise money to tackle problems wholly unconnected by their offence but caused by real criminals.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
